intro: Phacelia peirsoniana, commonly known as the Peirson's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous regions. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
